definition: to hold back/to check (i.e. to stop sb's advance)/to resist/esp. with negative, irresistible, unstoppable etc

sentences.english: Now, they have a treatment that arrests or halts the disease process, " Muenzer said."
sentences.chinese: 现在，他们可以通过治疗遏止住病情的发展。

sentences.english: FDA looks to curb abuse of cough medicine.
sentences.chinese: 美国FDA计划出台措施，遏止滥用止咳药。

sentences.english: China has promised repeatedly to take tougher measures to curb piracy.
sentences.chinese: 中国已一再承诺，会采取更强硬的措施来遏止盗版。

sentences.english: And we’ve stemmed the increases in naturalization fees.
sentences.chinese: 我们遏止了移民归化手续费的上涨。

sentences.english: The serum that could stop the outbreak was 674 miles away in Anchorage.
sentences.chinese: 遏止疫病的血清远在六百七十四英里外的安克雷奇市。

sentences.english: The ASI is the ball in a tube type to clamp on.
sentences.chinese: 的ASI是球在一个管式，以遏止有关。

sentences.english: If multi-channel channel conflict occurred, they usually stop annoy by punishment measurement.
sentences.chinese: 当面临多通路的通路冲突，多以惩罚手段遏止。

sentences.english: The authority should adopt strong methods to suppress on-campus and off-campus bullying.
sentences.chinese: 当局应该采取强硬手段遏止校内外霸凌事件。

sentences.english: What can be done to stem the crisis?
sentences.chinese: 可以做些什么以遏止危机呢？

sentences.english: To find yourself in a garret shows that you need to curb your vanities .
sentences.chinese: 找到自己在一个阁楼表明，你需要以遏止您的面盆。

sentences.english: It also stops students from competing with one another over what clothes they wear each day.
sentences.chinese: 穿制服也可遏止学生在每天的穿著打扮上相互竞争。

sentences.english: The doctors worked around the clock to stem the epidemic.
sentences.chinese: 医生们不眠不休地为遏止传染病而工作。

definition: to grow (usually of abstract things)/to yield/to develop
(literary) to eliminate/to put an end to
(of a watercourse) to breach its dike/(of dikes) to collapse
to get into disarray/to get out of whack
to stabilize/to keep (prices, vermin etc) under control
